verses.verse: There is <S%H3426><s%> an evil <S%H7451><s%> which I have seen <S%H7200><s%> <S%H8804><s%> under the sun <S%H8121><s%>, and it is common <S%H7227><s%> among men <S%H120><s%>:

A man <S%H376><s%> to whom 'Elohim <S%H430><s%> hath given <S%H5414><s%> <S%H8799><s%> riches <S%H6239><s%>, wealth <S%H5233><s%>, and honour <S%H3519><s%>, so that he wanteth <S%H2638><s%> nothing for his soul <S%H5315><s%> of all that he desireth <S%H183><s%> <S%H8691><s%>, yet 'Elohim <S%H430><s%> giveth him not power <S%H7980><s%> <S%H8686><s%> to eat <S%H398><s%> <S%H8800><s%> thereof, but a stranger <S%H376><s%> <S%H5237><s%> eateth <S%H398><s%> <S%H8799><s%> it: this is vanity <S%H1892><s%>, and it is an evil <S%H7451><s%> disease <S%H2483><s%>.

If a man <S%H376><s%> beget <S%H3205><s%> <S%H8686><s%> an hundred <S%H3967><s%> children, and live <S%H2421><s%> <S%H8799><s%> many <S%H7227><s%> years <S%H8141><s%>, so that the days <S%H3117><s%> of his years <S%H8141><s%> be many <S%H7227><s%>, and his soul <S%H5315><s%> be not filled <S%H7646><s%> <S%H8799><s%> with good <S%H2896><s%>, and also that he have no burial <S%H6900><s%>; I say <S%H559><s%> <S%H8804><s%>, that an untimely birth <S%H5309><s%> is better <S%H2896><s%> than he.

For he cometh <S%H935><s%> <S%H8804><s%> in with vanity <S%H1892><s%>, and departeth <S%H3212><s%> <S%H8799><s%> in darkness <S%H2822><s%>, and his name <S%H8034><s%> shall be covered <S%H3680><s%> <S%H8792><s%> with darkness <S%H2822><s%>.

Moreover he hath not seen <S%H7200><s%> <S%H8804><s%> the sun <S%H8121><s%>, nor known <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8804><s%> any thing: this <S%H2088><s%> hath more rest <S%H5183><s%> than <S%H2088><s%> the other.

Yea, though <S%H432><s%> he live <S%H2421><s%> <S%H8804><s%> a thousand <S%H505><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> twice <S%H6471><s%> told, yet hath he seen <S%H7200><s%> <S%H8804><s%> no good <S%H2896><s%>: do not all go <S%H1980><s%> <S%H8802><s%> to one <S%H259><s%> place <S%H4725><s%> ?
All the labour <S%H5999><s%> of man <S%H120><s%> is for his mouth <S%H6310><s%>, and yet the appetite <S%H5315><s%> is not filled <S%H4390><s%> <S%H8735><s%>.

For what hath the wise <S%H2450><s%> more <S%H3148><s%> than the fool <S%H3684><s%>? what hath the poor <S%H6041><s%>, that knoweth <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8802><s%> to walk <S%H1980><s%> <S%H8800><s%> before the living <S%H2416><s%> ?

Better <S%H2896><s%> is the sight <S%H4758><s%> of the eyes <S%H5869><s%> than the wandering <S%H1980><s%> <S%H8800><s%> of the desire <S%H5315><s%>: this is also vanity <S%H1892><s%> and vexation <S%H7469><s%> of spirit <S%H7307><s%>.

That which hath been is named <S%H7121><s%> <S%H8738><s%> <S%H8034><s%> already <S%H3528><s%>, and it is known <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8737><s%> that it is man <S%H120><s%>: neither may <S%H3201><s%> <S%H8799><s%> he contend <S%H1777><s%> <S%H8800><s%> with him that is mightier <S%H8623><s%> than he.
Seeing there be <S%H3426><s%> many <S%H7235><s%> <S%H8687><s%> things <S%H1697><s%> that increase <S%H7235><s%> <S%H8688><s%> vanity <S%H1892><s%>, what is man <S%H120><s%> the better <S%H3148><s%> ?

For who knoweth <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8802><s%> what is good <S%H2896><s%> for man <S%H120><s%> in this life <S%H2416><s%>, all <S%H4557><s%> the days <S%H3117><s%> of his vain <S%H1892><s%> life <S%H2416><s%> which he spendeth <S%H6213><s%> <S%H8799><s%> as a shadow <S%H6738><s%>? for who can tell <S%H5046><s%> <S%H8686><s%> a man <S%H120><s%> what shall be after <S%H310><s%> him under the sun <S%H8121><s%> ?
